attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into how unelected cabinet ministers can make undemocratic constitutional decisions in a democracy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to: 'anounce a public enquiry' into how unelected cabinet ministers are able to make constitutional decisions about the UK, and refuse the public a say on the matter.

The government is currently being controlled by a a large number of unelected Ministers, there appear to be seven unelected senior cabinet ministers running this country allegedly in the name of the people. None of these senior government figures have a genuine mandate or even a single vote from the people of the UK. We say that this situation is a disgrace, a breach of our democratic rights in a democracy. We need a public enquiry as to how this undemocratic dictatorship has arisen in a free democracy.
